author: Nicholas Garber
text: 'If you want excellent Neapolitan style pizza this is your place. It‚Äôs not dominos and it‚Äôs not NY slice
column5: so if that‚Äôs what you want go elsewhere.'

author: Dr. Erdal OZKAYA
text: 'Nice'

author: Lucia Arias
text: 'Best pizzas in town'

author: Cez Ramone (Cez)
text: "Individual pizzas A+ /Coal Oven A+\nSo bad they don't open earlier ..."

author: Taylor Bennett
text: 'Best pizza in Hoboken. Hands down. Super fresh ingredients and cute/quirky atmosphere. Definitely a hidden gem!'

author: cristina marin
text: 'Personally
column5: this is the best pizza I‚Äôve had in Hoboken so far!! The crust and the combination of the ingredients are above excellence! High quality pizza!'

author: Amado Fernandez
text: 'Tasty pizza'

author: Elisa I
text: 'No substitutions but pizzas are always *chefs kiss*'

author: Pearl Stars
text: 'Great hidden gem of Hoboken. Book in advance to get a nice seating space but on a less busy day
column5: you can also get outdoor seating. Awesome pizzas and the place allows you to bring your own drink.'

author: Gizem Acar
text: 'I have mixed feelings about Dozzino. Their pizza is usually the best out there
column5: but sometimes they mess up the dough
column6: and you may end up with thick
column7: not-fully-cooked dough that is no good.'

author: Amel Mustajbasic
text: 'Great food
column5: and a great atmosphere. Meatballs were amazing
column6: will be going back.'

author: Ed Bocchino
text: 'Artisinal Pizza di Napoli with fresh high quality ingredients and authentic flavors. House style is undercooked in the center with a charred exterior. Take it or leave it attitude from the staff and owner. Quirky little place has a certain charm to it but not for everyone.'

author: Jessica Harrod
text: "First
column5: I want to say
column6: terrible food. I've tried it. Not impressed.\n\nSecondly
column7: they openly admitted on Facebook that they hung up a sign that said they won't serve Trump supporters. Like what? I'm not even one but am confused by the audacity to exclude others based on political beliefs."

author: Robert Rose
text: 'So good. Fluffy and delightful. Byob but place next door with good beer selection.'

author: Frank Beatrice
text:
'**Not talking about taste or quality -> Dozzino Pizza is way too small.
You will have much better portions at most other restaurant in Hoboken.

If you are on a date or having any type of meeting over Wine & Pizza -> Dozzino is a Good spot!!! 3-4 stars

But if you are looking to eat or takeout & enjoy a reasonable amount of food...This is definitely not the place.'

author: Joseph McCormack
text: 'The pizza has a liquid on top of it that created a hole in the middle of the pizza. Complete waste of money.go somewhere else.'

author: James Amrod
text: 'Enjoyed all the food and service was excellent.'

author: Irene Evangelou
text: 'Love their pizza..'

author: Efnan T√ºrk
text: 'The best artizan pizza around this area! Pizzas are not small also they have really good size for one person. I really liked that place
column5: backyard is really cute especially in fall :) Service was great
column6: they are really helpful
column7: kind and fastiest! thank you guys!'

author: Eric Cheon
text: 'Amazing little pizza place with a cute backyard seating area.'

author: Diana Jin
text: "Honestly
column5: it's very average food at best. In a city that has 100 options for pizza and other Italian fares
column6: it's a wonder how this place is still in business! Pizza is very doughy in an almost undercooked way
column8: the crust is pretty burnt in areas
column9: making it inedible (unless you enjoy ingesting ash and charcoal). The plastic cutlery and tiny paper plates provided during the meal made this seem more like a Chuck-e-cheese pizza party than a legit restaurant. Won't be returning."

author: Valerie Smith
text: "The food was decent. The service wasn't great."

author: Jim Downey
text: "First understand its not NY style pizza
column5:
know what you're going for.

I've been there many times and I've had great service. One occasion it started to pour and they were very accommodating to make sure we didn't get wet.

Pizza is amazing
column6: crust is exactly what it should be. Quality ingredients and someone really knows how to treat dough."

author: Vanessa Chang
text: 'great pizza spot'

author: John Wolff
text:
'(Translated by Google) Very good! I recommend this restaurant for a piece of authentic pizza but the service is not good

(Original)
Buonissimo! vi raccomando questo ristorante per un pezzo di pizza autentico ma il servizo non fa bene'

author: Ari Freuman
text: "Pizza is really good
column5: and that's what matters. Recently I received slightly undercooked pie
column6: so I didn't love that."

author: Ludovic MASSON
text:
"BYOB
Never enough even if you are full. So good !!
Everything is home made and serve on good quantities.
You can't resist to their pizza. Love them so much !!"

author: Molly Lakis
text: 'The food is always delicious and fresh and the staff is wonderful!'

author: Samantha Cagman
text: 'Excellent food and atmosphere!'

author: Maya Hassieb
text: 'Amazing pizza! This is a wonderful place with awesome ambiance and a beautiful outdoor space. The owners are kind people and the waitstaff has always been attentive and friendly. We‚Äôve gone to a few birthday parties at Dozzino and everything was always smoothly run. We have been supporting this small business with take out through Covid and will continue to support them in anyway.'

author: Vicky Song
text: 'They were extremely proactive in protecting customers from covid19 and the restaurant is really cute!'

author: Palvi Gulati Verma
text: "Ordered a Large Pizza (or whatever random name they call it). But I paid $37 bucks - So you are kind of expecting the pizza to be delicious. Its a take out. But you are expecting it to be sliced
column5: maybe just give me oregano or chlli flakes on the side. Nope. That's fine
column6: not a big deal. But considering I paid top dollars - the pizza was so chewy - our jaws were hurting from eating it. It was below average in taste and flavor. Was definitely expecting more from a top dollar pizza place!"

author: Kevin Recio
text: 'Best artisanal pizza in Hoboken
column5: but call ahead to see what they have in stock - they have a tendency to run out of ingredients. Unbelievable crust.'

author: Ronald Cillio
text: 'Best pizza in town! Treats you like family.'

author: Denis Gilmore
text: 'not bad'

author: philip shimko
text: 'Great crust!'

author: Trevor Darling
text: 'Nice little spot with good pizza and quick service
column5: also BYOB. The ‚Äúhoney‚Äù and ‚Äúspicy pepperoni‚Äù pizza stood out among all ordered (‚Äúla pizza‚Äù pictured) and all had a fluffy chewy crust. Many had basil listed as an ingredient and no basil to be seen; would have helped complete the package on some of the pies (BYOBasil?). Sauce is somewhat bitter and overall the flavors fell somewhat flat. Worth a try
column6: could easily be someone‚Äôs favorite with a slightly different taste preference.'

author: Harrison Meyer
text: "Don't get me wrong
column5: the food was great! Good on the chef
column6: but the two guys in the front of house who take orders and serve are an absolute nightmare . I went there with my girlfriend for dinner and we were one of two parties in the restaurant. They didn't have any music going
column7: the only thing you could hear was those two guys showing each other videos and joking around and yelling. It was honestly so obnoxious I don't think I will go back! If you want to succeed get ur employees to be more professional please."

author: Radima Alakaeva
text: 'Delicious pizza and latte!'

author: Travis and Stacey
text: 'Maturity of staff zero. Food amazing.\n\nBest pizza I‚Äôve had outside of Manhattan. The downside (major downside) was the 2 guys behind the counter joking around very loudly
column5: giggling
column6: shouting playing around the whole time we were eating. Distracting
column7: annoying and unfortunately took away from how we enjoyed our meal.'

author: Matthew Choman
text: "Great rice balls and meatballs. Pizzas are just okay.  Dough is too thick/doughy for my tastes. Very fairly priced and BYO. Service was below average. Won't be returning to this spot."

author: Vivek Narayanan
text: 'Excellent wood fired oven to taste some authentic Neapolitan pizza. Their sauce on the la pizza tasted a little too salty but overall
column5: they use very high quality ingredients in their preparations. Must try in hoboken!'

author: Ines Cruz da Silva
text: 'Best pizza in the Jersey City / Hoboken area!'

author: simon bouty
text: 'Quite disappointed. We‚Äôve just received our pizza and they are burnt and the special one aka $19 with artichokes
column5: spinach and prosciutto contains only 1 small piece of artichoke!!!!! üò≥ Really???\nPizza are good but it‚Äôs way too expensive for the prestations.'

author: Kristina Rogan
text: 'TERRIBLE service. Food was decent
column5: but not worth the insult of interacting with the staff. Don‚Äôt bother - Hoboken has much better pizza places
column6: with much better service.'

author: Jimmy Lee
text: 'This is not your American-style pizza place.  Everything is fresh and taste legit. I will definitely recommend this place. Drinks are limited so BYOB.'

author: Scott Lagattuta
text: 'We had both my kids communion parties there and they did a great job both times'

author: pallavi kapadia
text: 'Good food and service'

author: Andrea Fajardo
text: 'Loveeed Dozzino!! A group of friends and I went for my birthday and the staff was amazing
column5: the food was delicious
column6: and the space is beautiful. I recommend x 100!'

author: Russell Francis
text: 'Great tasting pizza.  However
column5: if you order the pizza with pancetta
column6: don‚Äôt expect much pancetta. Literally 2 tiny slivers (which is unfair on slivers).  And if you order the spinach and artichoke
column7: don‚Äôt expect any artichoke.  And if you call to ask about things
column8: don‚Äôt expect much in the way of customer service.  And don‚Äôt expect it to be cut up either. It‚Äôs a tear and share type thing.  Basically.  If you have low expectations

author: Del Von
text: 'Like Wow Just the Smell of That Pizza make me Hungry'

author: Adam Blaby
text: 'Very good pizza! Nice change to the typical NY pizza. Only issue is Bruschetta is simply tomatoes and crackers for $7. Oh well.'

author: Julia Pasquale
text: 'My favorite pizza spot in Hoboken.'

author: K Vodak
text: 'Pizza tastes like dirt!'

author: Matthew Quinlan
text: 'Awesome food. Try the pizza! Or else üòâ'

author: Joe Minuti
text: 'Good pizza and a clean restaurant.'

author: Richard Chatterton
text: 'Best pizza I have had for years! Absolute gem'

author: Meagan
text: 'Great place to have an event! My fianc√© and I had our engagement party here in October and it was perfect. It‚Äôs a nice rustic minimalistic place with an outdoor area. We had a ton of fun and the pizza was great!'

author: Erica Barrows
text: "Best pizza I've ever had!!"

author: Elizabeth Madzin
text: 'The food was very delicious
column5: but hands down the strangest dining experience. First of all there is NO ICE on the premises
column6: my friend had a bottle of white wine that she had to drink room temperature
column7: which was not enjoyable. They didn‚Äôt refill our waters
column8: and brought out the main dishes staggered not all at once. We also had to remind them of my main dish. Once the food came it was delicious but as a diner very strange'

author: Douglas Puchowski
text: "Probably the best pizza in Hoboken; definitely the best I've had there."

author: Cheri Van Nice
text: 'The pizza was delicious. Even my Italian boyfriend could tell that the dough was fresh made. Wait staff was great and everything we ordered was amazing. If anything was extra
column5: they let us know right when we asked for it. I highly recommend the meatball app. They were small
column6: but in large quantity and delicious!'

author: Sanwari Gupta
text: "It's a cute place
column5: pizza is a decent but a bit extra on the base. The toppings are minimal. And they charge extra for olive oil
column6: which I thought was kind of strange. But a good place to try"

author: James Melgarejo
text: 'Best pizza. Hands down'

author: jdizzinyaear
text: 'Hands down best pizza in the city. Family friendly with outdoor seatings. BYOB as well. Just get there in time before the pizza runs out! Personal favorite pizza is "The Honey"'

author: J J
text: 'Great tasting pizza
column5: really cozy place!'

author: Walter Zielenski
text: "Best artisan style pizza I've had in Hoboken so far.\n\nTrendy little cafe/pizzeria where you don't have to spend a lot of money to have a good time. BYOB and hang out outside for a few hours
column5: playing bocce. The staff is kind
column6: attentive
column7: and patient. Invited to stay as long as we needed to finish the drinks we brought
column8: after we already paid the check."

author: Martin Poceiro
text: 'Pizza is good. Service poor. They tried to squeeze me
column5: my wife and our baby into a tiny table for 2. We asked for a bigger one and said no because we were 2. We sat down anyways. 10 minutes later a couple sat down next to us in a bigger table (for 3 or 4). They said they made an exception for whatever reason. Sad'

author: Ryan Crimmins
text: 'Never disappoints. Delicious pizza
column5: especially the diavolo
column6: and a cool space. Had a big group of family there (14 adults and kids) for a 1st birthday and they were very accommodating.'

author: Andrew G
text: "Truly excellent pizza - fresh ingredients
column5: great cheese
column6: amazing crust - with friendly and quick service in a very nice space
column7: including very inviting outdoor seating. Competitors: take note. Zany toppings and long-winded stories about the family business don't make up mediocre or downright bad pizza. This place is a neighborhood gem for the pizza alone."

author: Sean Smeltzer
text: 'Very good pizza. Nice staff. Great seating area.'

author: Alessandro Cardito
text: 'Excellent Neapolitan pizza! This place doesn‚Äôt get the traffic it deserves- great pizza and nice place'

author: Brandon Felice
text: 'Awesome food. Super down to earth and accommodating staff. Amazing for pretty much everything - weekday bite
column5: cup of Italian espresso or renting out for a daytime birthday party. We‚Äôve done them all multi times and always been spot on.'

author: Michael Ahrendt
text: "I walk past this place almost every weekend since it's right by my apartment and finally decided to go it a try since I love pizza. Brought my gf and it was an amazing experience. Meat plate and bruscetta were fantastic and the za was delicious. They were out of quite a few apps
column5: and some pizzas
column6: but that's what you get when all their ingredients are top quality and local/fresh. Definitely sit outside!"

author: Kissy T.
text: 'Everything was good and fresh. I just wish there were more appetizer options.'

author: Timothy Lohse
text: 'Great food made with locally sourced fresh ingredients. Simply exellent.'

author: Liat Rosenberg
text: 'Great pizza
column5: great atmosphere'

author: Juan Lopez
text: 'I placed my order for delivery at 7.30pm
column5: 1 hour passes by and no pizza so I called them
column6: they asked me to wait on hold
column8: and then they disconnected the phone. Now it‚Äôs 9.30pm
column9: no pizza to be found and hopefully I‚Äôll get a refund from seamless ... what a joke! WILL NEVER ORDER THERE AGAIN!!'

author: Michael Mastrovito
text: "Got the spinach pie
column5: it barely had any cheese on it. I had to put olive oil on 2 of the slices since it was essentially just bread. The food itself was actually really good where there was cheese and spinach. Unfortunately I didn't plan on wasting $14 on bread."

author: Zarait Pacheco
text: 'We are so disappointed with everything at this place
column5: we order from Uber and everything was bad
column6: pizza undercooked salad horrible. They have high prices for what they are making $7 dollars for a salad which it came in a small plate cover with Aluminum paper and haft of it was bad that we didn‚Äôt even eat
column7: I wish I can put a picture of how it came.'

author: Christine Sosnowski
text: 'Great pizza!'

author: Gavin
text: 'Very good pizza
column5: but pricey.'

author: Alan H Burghauser MD
text: 'The best pizza in the world! One problem however. They don‚Äôt allow special orders. Can‚Äôt say I‚Äôll take the napolitano pizza without onions! You must take what they make. No exceptions! But it‚Äôs great stuff!\nOutside ding with your pet. Works great.'

author: Ryan Robbins
text: 'The pizza is fluffy & light. But only come here if you‚Äôre a big fan of white pizza. They have 2 red pies on the whole menu and you can‚Äôt add toppings to any of the pies. The service is friendly
column5: but lacking in English communication.\nI don‚Äôt understand why they can‚Äôt add toppings for an up charge. All I wanted was a red pizza with artichoke hearts on it. The only red pizzas they had were cheese and margarita. üôÑ'

author: Jason Oermann
text: 'Pizza is way better than the slices you can grab near the path train.  Been here numerous times and have never had a bad meal.  Highly recommend trying their seasonal/special pies.  Amazing outdoor space for when it‚Äôs nice out'

author: Hannah Redmond
text: 'Great space
column5: service and food. Perfect for a large group who enjoys artisan pizza and a chill vibe.'

author: Jiaren Li
text: 'Delicious pizza with very interesting yet amazing topping choices. BYOB is a plus. Highly recommend for normal weeknights when it is simple to find seats. Friendly staff members and overall very  pleasant services. Among artisanal style pizza places
column5: this is fairly unique and you should try it.'

author: Jack Sachitano
text: 'As visitors from Oregon
column5: we were taken here by our son and his girlfriend who live up the hill in Union City. Really good pizza and extras (meatballs
column6: brocolli
column8: crustini). The service was excellant and the staff was very friendly and attentive. Enjoyable meal.'

author: Stevens Florez
text: 'Solid place. High quality pizza and great ambiance. Never enough ingredients.'

author: Matthew Hartsough
text: "Check out the board when you walk in for specials. The reserve menu is pricey but worth it. Don't skip the breakfast pizza with egg
column5: maple syrup
column6: and melted butter."

author: Chip Lugosi
text: 'Great pizzeria. Great service.'

author: Chris Shimmin
text: 'Awesome pizza! BYOB which is awesome. The outdoors patio is very nice. Inside is small and you may have to wait.'

author: Lacy Gayda
text: 'We rented out the space for my son‚Äôs first birthday party and couldn‚Äôt have been happier. The food was delicious (pizza
column5: salads
column6: meatballs) and the staff was AMAZING. Super helpful and friendly to all of the kids
column7: family and friends. Jennifer from Sugarsuckle delivered the cake and cookies to the event the day of the party (also delicious!) so it was super easy for us to throw together!\n\nNote: You can get a discount at Capporinos Liquor store (next door) when you purchase your BYOB there. AND Puppetonia did a puppet show for us that the kids LOVED! The way the restaurant is set up we were able to make a ‚Äúkid area‚Äù and an ‚Äúadult area‚Äù so the parents could get a little break.'

author: Doug Silverberg
text: 'Very good pizza
column5: bring your own for liquor. Outdoor patio is very nice. Weekdays you can get in easily but weekends get very busy!'

author: Erin Carrather
text: 'Awesome pizza (the dough is to die for) & meatballs. Great BYO spot.'

author: Andres Diaz-Borda
text: 'Great Brick oven pizza'

author: Lukasz Dec
text: "A great place for unique pizza made out of fresh ingredients. Quick efficient service and most importantly it's BYOB."

author: Jonathan Rivera
text: "Ok place but don't like the menu is so limited"

author: Jason Nickel
text: 'Bocce. Pizza. Beer. Fun spot and worth the wait (if there is one).'

author: Tyrone Fulcher
text: 'Awesome little Italian place with  good food.'

author: Noelle ‚ÄúBatykefer‚Äù Tabor
text: 'Good food. Great service.'

author: Steven Wilk
text: 'Great food and prices.'

author: John Wright
text: 'great food in a great atmosphere. It is BYOB
column5: but there is a liquor store two doors down.'

author: Justin
text: "wish they put banana's on their pizza"

author: Michael Zittel
text: 'Nice pizza. Tastey. One of my favorites. The hot onion pizza is really good.'

author: Chris Lau
text: 'Good pizza but pricey'

author: javisol2
text:
'(Translated by Google) Tasted good

(Original)
Gut geschmeckt'

author: Brian
text: 'Great BYOB pizza option in Hoboken. A little off the beaten path but way better then most.'

author: Noah King
text: 'Awesome little Italian place with pretty good food. The best thing about it is the super fun and friendly waitstaff
column5: with a super layed back atmosphere.'

author: J A
text: 'This place is simple and awesome. Always check out the specials of the day and bring your own booze and if you want
column5: your own ice.'

author: Malcolm
text: 'Order the honey pie'

author: David Smentkowski
text: 'Everything'

author: Sharon Yates
text: 'The pizza is delicious! I love the laid back feel of this place. The waiters are very patient with kids during the earlier part of the evening.  Perfect place for parties too.'

author: Eduardo Fernandez
text: 'Expensive for just average food
column5: but the service is just ridiculous ... and the owner is the worst of them all!'

author: Caroline Falchier
text: "The food is great.  The Breakfast Club Pizza is the best minus the fact that I've eaten at Dozzino's 12 times and only be able to order twice.  They should call it the Unicorn Pizza."

author: Rosalie Trigona
text: "We had the worst experience hosting a party at this mediocre at best pizza place.  The owner
column5: Marc
column6: does not know how to run a restaurant or handle a private party.  He completely under ordered food for our party and had no one there to manage our party.  In fact
column7: when our party arrived and they knew that there wasn't enough food - they did nothing expect demand we pay for service that wasn't provided.  How do you run out of salad and pizza when your a pizza place?!  They clearly couldn't handle our party
column9: in my opinion. Even worse was the food; what little made was inedible  - the pasta with roasted tomatoes was not freshly prepared and instead tasted like Ragu from a store bought sauce.  We were so disappointed with how Dozzino handled our party
column12: and food.  Many guests left early because there was no food and it was such an embarrassment.  Living in Hoboken as a local for many years
column13: it is shocking to me how such a place still can be in business. Turns out Dozzino has problems with running out of food and poorly managed parties in the past - wish we knew that before we made the mistake of trusting them with our own party.  Don't waste your time or money on this place."

author: Nicolas Sotgui
text: 'Nice backyard and pizza and you can bring your own bottle which is really cool.'

author: Joseph Rocchio
text: "I've been to Dozzinos several times now and look forward to it every time! I live in NY and make the trip for their ingredients
column5: atmosphere
column6: specials and a little banter with the staff and owner. Great pizza
column7: great spot - worth the price! For those who are looking for a quick slice thats been sitting around and you can get anywhere
column8: this isn't the place for you. Good spot to watch the World Cup and during Summer and Fall months with outdoor seating!"

author: Jamie Yorke
text:
"I'm Sorry!!!! But the reviewers who gave DOZZINO a bad rating for the quality of the food or level of service... I don't know what planet you are on!!!!

I dined at DOZZINO's earlier this week with a friend... we turned up late (9pm) but we were welcomed with a smile and seated straight away even though the place was busy.

The food was superb and the service was great and we didn't feel like we were being rushed to leave even though the kitchen closed at 9:30pm...

DOZZINO... based on their concept
column5: limited menu and location is perfect and I will definitely go back in a heart beat."

author: Jay Avondoglio
text: 'Very expensive.  What a shame... Great ingredients
column5: rude
column6: stuck-up staff who swore like sailors.  All but 2 inches of crust was burnt black.'

author: Vincenzo Grasso
text:
'(Translated by Google) true Italian

(Original)
vero italiano'

author: John Rutter
text: "The dough at Dozzino is amazing.  Try to save space for the mascarpone  crostini for dessert.  It's phenomenal."

author: Jim Powell
text: 'The service here is atrocious.  They\'re pushy
column5: rude
column6: conceited
column7: and they really take a "customer is always wrong" attitude to their business.  And surprisingly... this attitude really seems originate directly from the owner.\n\nThe pizza is also VERY overpriced. Pizzas start at $12 a tiny pie that are only meant to serve 1 person
column8: and you\'ll likely still be hungry (especially if you\'re a guy).\n\nDo yourself a favor and take your money elsewhere
column9: because they clearly don\'t want it.'

author: Christa Conte Alenier
text: 'This is one of the best pizza places in Hoboken. The fresh ingredients and wood fire oven give you flavors that you could never even believe. I love the bocce court in the back as well. There is a secret menu too where you can basically order a number of meat and cheese combinations. The service is very quick and accommodating to large groups as well.'

author: Matt Galo
text: 'The pizza is excellent...very different from your standard pizzeria. I only wish they had more options on the menu.'

author: Carlo Lipizzi
text: 'Overall it\'s still the best place for Italian pizza (not the ItalianAmerican) in Hoboken. With some "but ..."\n\nI like being minimalistic
column5: till it becomes boring. This is border line. Basically same menu
column6: same everything since the opening.'
